subject: Re: Programming By Contract
msgSnippet: ... You probably shouldn t be trying to put pretty error messages out when an assertion has failed.  When an assertion fails, all bets are off and you want to
messageBody:
--- In junit@egroups.com, tony.heap@t... wrote:

> according to Sun's guidelines on exception handling you should not
> be trying to catch and handle Errors, but I do want to, in order to
> be able to display a 'pretty' error message in my production
> system.
>
> Any thoughts?

You probably shouldn't be trying to put pretty error messages out
when an assertion has failed. When an assertion fails, all bets are
off and you want to bomb and know about it quick.

If your expecting the error, and expecting to have to deal with it,
that's not an assertion, it's normal error handling.

Alan
